This article needs additional citations for verification. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. (July 2013) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)
Thermal water park in Bešeňová, Slovakia

The following is a list of water parks in the world sorted by region. A water park or waterpark is an amusement park that features water play areas, such as water slides, splash pads, spraygrounds (water playgrounds), lazy rivers, wave pools, or other recreational bathing, swimming, and barefooting environments.

Germany[edit]

Sauna, thermal pools, and Stonehenge at Therme Erding

England[edit]

Alton Towers Waterpark, previously named Cariba Creek, at Alton Towers Theme Park
  • Alton Towers Waterpark, Staffordshire – also known as Cariba Creek, part of the Alton Towers Resort
  • Brean Splash, Brean, Somerset – an indoor and outdoor fun pool at Brean Leisure Park
  • Calypso Cove at the Barnsley Metrodome, Barnsley, South Yorkshire
  • Coral Reef Waterworld, Bracknell, Berkshire [71]
  • Sandcastle, Blackpool – an indoor water park with a tropical climate[72]
  • Scarborough Alpamare Water Park, Scarborough, North Yorkshire – Alpine themed indoor & outdoor waterpark.[73]
  • Splashdown Quaywest in Goodrington, Devon – UK's largest open air water park[74]
  • Splashdown, Poole, Dorset
  • Water World, Stoke-on-Trent – claims to be the No.1 water park in the UK, with over 400,000 annual visitors[75]
  • Wet N Wild, North Shields, Tyne and Wear

Scotland[edit]

  • The Time Capsule, Coatbridge - has a network of pools, water rides, a whirlpool and an ice rink

Wales[edit]

  • Blue Lagoon, Pembrokeshire – an indoor water park
  • Cardiff International Pool – part of the Cardiff International Sports Village
  • LC, Swansea

Oceania[edit]

Wet'n'Wild Water World's Tornado

Australia[edit]

Australian Capital Territory[edit]

  • Big Splash, Canberra[76]

New South Wales[edit]

  • Jamberoo Action Park, Jamberoo[77]
  • Wet'n'Wild Sydney[78]
  • The Big Banana Fun Park, Coffs Harbour

Queensland[edit]

  • Sugarworld[79]
  • Wet'n'Wild Gold Coast, Gold Coast[80]
  • WhiteWater World, Gold Coast[81]

  • The Beachouse, Adelaide[82]

  • Adventure Park, Geelong[83]
  • Funfields, Whittlesea[84]

Western Australia[edit]

  • Adventure World, Perth[85]

New Zealand[edit]

  • Waiwera Hot Pools, Auckland[88]
  • Waterworld, Hamilton[89]

Defunct water parks[edit]

Canada[edit]

  • Skinner's Wet'n Wild, Lockport, Manitoba - closed in 2005
  • Penguin Village, Saskatoon, Saskatchewan - closed in 1990

Japan[edit]

  • Seagaia Ocean Dome, Miyazaki - closed as of 2007
  • Sports World Izunagaoka, Shizuoka
  • Wild Blue Yokohama, Yokohama

Netherlands[edit]

  • Nationaal zwemcentrum de Tongelreep, Eindhoven – the recreational part has been closed since September 2016

Palestinian territories[edit]

  • Crazy Water Park, Gaza Strip – burned down in arson attack[90]

Russia[edit]

  • Transvaal Park,[91] Moscow – in 2004, 28 people were killed when a roof collapsed

  • Lake Dolores Waterpark, Newberry Springs, California

  • Ogle's Water Park, Sevierville, Tennessee

  • Waterland USA, Houma, Louisiana
